atAGlance.mustRegister: People convicted of Vermont registrable offenses and people with **comparable out-of-state/federal/military** convictions who live, work, or study in VT (see [13 V.S.A. §5407](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407) and definitions in [§5401](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05401)).
atAGlance.initialDeadline: Move-ins / workers / students: register within **10 days** of establishing presence; visitors: **10 consecutive days** or **30 days/year** triggers a duty (see [§5407(a)(1)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407)).
atAGlance.verificationCadence: Annually (within 10 days after birthday); **SVP** verify **every 90 days** ([§5407(e)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407)).
atAGlance.primaryMethod: Central registry via VCIC (mail/phone). Photo & fingerprints at VT State Police when instructed ([VCIC: VT registrants](https://vcic.vermont.gov/sor/vermont-registrants), [VCIC: out-of-state](https://vcic.vermont.gov/sor/out-of-state)).
topGotchas: Report address/employment/school/name changes within **3 days** (address = **36 hours** if high-risk) ([§5407(d)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407), [§5411b(c)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05411b)).
Knowing failure to comply is a **felony** ([§5409](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05409)).
Not all registrants are on the public website; posting depends on offense/risk ([§5411a](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05411a)).

whoMustRegister: Adults convicted of listed sex offenses (e.g., [§3252](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/72/03252) sexual assault; [§3253](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/72/03253) aggravated sexual assault; [§2601](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/67/02601) lewd & lascivious; [§2602](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/67/02602) with a child; Ch. 64 child-exploitation) and **comparable** out-of-state/federal/military convictions (see [§5401](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05401)). Move-ins, workers, and students from out of state must register ([§5407(a)(1)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407)). Youth cases kept in juvenile court generally do **not** register.
deadlinesReporting: Initial report (out-of-state conviction moving to or working/studying in VT): within **10 days** ([§5407(a)(1)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407)).
Annual verification: sign/return within **10 days after birthday** ([§5407(e)(1)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407)).

Changes (address, employment, post-secondary school, legal name): within **3 days**; **high-risk** address change within **36 hours** ([§5407(d)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407), [§5411b(c)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05411b)).
verificationInPerson: VCIC mails verification around birthday; registrant must sign/return within 10 days ([§5407(e)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407)).
VCIC may require updated photo; photo/fingerprints done at VT State Police when instructed ([VCIC out-of-state steps](https://vcic.vermont.gov/sor/out-of-state)).
residencyPresence: No **statewide** residency or loitering zones in statute; individualized limits may be imposed by probation/parole while under supervision. Local ordinances are uncommon but check your municipality. State law itself does **not** impose buffer zones.
employmentEducationInternet: Report employment or post-secondary school changes within **3 days** ([§5407(d)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407)).
Public site does not display employer details; supervision may add job-specific limits case-by-case ([§5411a](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05411a)).
publicWebsiteExposure: Internet posting criteria set by statute/court; higher-risk and specified offenses are posted ([§5411a](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05411a)).
Public listing shows photo, offense, and **town** (not street address). Victim identity is never disclosed.
travelInterstate: Moving out of VT: notify VCIC and register in the new state within **3 days** of establishing residence ([§5407(d)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407)).
International travel: follow federal IML **21-day** advance notice via your local registry (contact VCIC for VT procedure).
visitingTraveling: Visitors with out-of-state convictions must register if present **10 consecutive days** or **30 days total/year** ([§5407(a)(1)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407)).
Short hotel stays under these thresholds do **not** trigger VT registration; still follow your **home state’s** travel-notice rules.
Homeless/transient must provide specific location details and follow VCIC check-in arrangements (see [VCIC](https://vcic.vermont.gov/sor/out-of-state)).
complianceEnforcement: Knowing failure to comply is a felony: up to **2 years** (first) or **5 years** (subsequent) and fines; sentences can run consecutively ([§5409](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05409)).
reliefPaths: Standard registration term is **10 years** after completion of sentence/supervision; certain offenses/designations are **lifetime** ([§5407(e)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407)).
Lifetime registrants may petition after **10 years** to end **public posting** if no longer high-risk ([§5411](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05411)).
specialPopulations: High-risk designation (DOC) increases duties; **noncompliant high-risk** have 30-day in-person check-ins and added requirements ([§5411b](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05411b), [§5411d](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05411d)).
**SVP** verify quarterly; additional disclosure rules apply ([§5407(e)(2)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407)).
costs: No routine state registration fee; local fingerprinting fees may apply (see [VCIC](https://vcic.vermont.gov/sor/out-of-state)).

newArrivalChecklist: Within **10 days** of arrival to live/work/study: contact VCIC; submit packet ([§5407(a)(1)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407), [VCIC](https://vcic.vermont.gov/sor/out-of-state)).
Complete photo/fingerprints at VTSP as directed.
movingOutChecklist: Notify VCIC of new address and departure date.
Register in your new state within **3 days** of establishing residence ([§5407(d)](https://legislature.vermont.gov/statutes/section/13/167/05407)).
Confirm VT shows you as moved; keep proof.

summary: Most registrants complete **10 years** after supervision; some offenses/designations are **lifetime**.
Updates are fast: **3 days** for changes; annual verification by birthday; SVP verify **quarterly**.
watchOuts: Visitors hitting **10 consecutive** or **30/year** must register.
Not everyone appears on the public site; posting depends on offense/risk.

watchOuts: High-risk address changes are due within **36 hours**.
Changing college enrollment counts as a **school change** and must be reported within **3 days**.

summary: Short hotel trips under **10 straight days** (and under **30 total/year**) generally **don’t** trigger VT registration.
Your **home state** may still require advance travel notice—follow those rules too.

summary: Missing a deadline can become a **new felony**; keep copies of what you submit and note dates sent/received.
